files.title: Overview
files.summary: Two operations are said to be *morally strong* relative to each other if they satisfy all of the following conditions:

files.title: 8.7.1. Conflict and Data-races
files.summary: Two *overlapping* memory operations are said to *conflict* when at least one of them is a *write*.

files.title: 8.7.2. Limitations on Mixed-size Data-races
files.summary: A *data-race* between operations that *overlap* completely is called a *uniform-size data-race*, while a *data-race* between operations that *overlap* partially is called a *mixed-size data-race*.
